Biography I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at Baylor University. Prior to joining Baylor, I was a visiting scholar hosted by Jianxi Gao in the CS department at RPI. I obtained a PhD in Applied Math from Department of Mathematical Sciences, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in August 2023, working under the supervision of Kristin Bennett. I have published many paper in top ML conferences, including NeurIPS, AAAI, ICML, CLeaR etc. I have served as a PC member for several international conferences, such as NeurIPS, AAAI, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS etc. Education Ph.D. (Applied Mathematics), RPI, 2023. M.S. (Computer Science), RPI, 2023. M.S. (Chemistry), Ohio State University, 2014. B.A. (Chemistry), (minor in applied math, east asian studies and Japanese), Wittenberg University, 2012. Research I am generally interested in machine/deep learning, optimization, and trustworthy AI, with a primary focus on (Neural) Marked Temporal Point Process & Sequential Data; Causal Inference & Learning; (Deep) Generative Models; Neural Network Training and Dynamics; Machine Learning for Health.
